Qualifiers.scope: Regulations governing the site planning and location of noise-producing equipment on a residential lot.
applicability: Applies to new installations of service equipment.
Applies to replacement of existing equipment 'where feasible'.
exclusions: General prohibition of equipment in front yards.
General prohibition of equipment in rear yards.
General prohibition of equipment in interior-side yards.

material_parameters.notes: This requirement can be waived under specific conditions.

environmental_parameters.value: Must comply with City's Noise Ordinance

numerical_values.description: Maximum encroachment into a street-side yard.
Minimum clear distance for a driveway (from Figure A example).

procedures.name: Waiver for insulation/housing requirement
procedures.description: The Planning Department can waive the requirement to insulate and house equipment.

mandatory: All service equipment must meet the City’s Noise Ordinance (Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code).
Equipment must be insulated and housed, unless a waiver is granted by the Planning Dept.

if: Equipment is located in the buildable area
A combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will assure compliance with the City’s Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line
conditional_logic.then: The Planning Dept. can waive the requirement for equipment to be insulated and housed.
It shall conform to this section.
conditional_logic.ambiguity_flag: The term 'where feasible' is subjective and not explicitly defined, requiring interpretation.

explicit_deviations.rule: Equipment may not be located in yards.
explicit_deviations.exception: Equipment may encroach into a street-side yard up to 6 feet.
explicit_deviations.notes: This exception does not apply to front, rear, or interior-side yards.

alternatives.requirement: Equipment must be insulated and housed.
alternatives.alternative: Achieve compliance with the Noise Ordinance through a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering, subject to Planning Dept. waiver.
alternatives.condition: Equipment must be located in the buildable area.

special_cases.rule: Must conform to the section's regulations.

on: Equipment location (must be in buildable area)
Demonstrated compliance with Noise Ordinance via alternative means

logical_dependencies.dependent: Permission to place equipment in a yard

ambiguous_language.context: Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
ambiguous_language.reason: Lacks objective criteria for determining feasibility, making it subject to interpretation.

ambiguous_language.context: Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-the-way niche...
ambiguous_language.reason: Descriptive but not a regulatory term with a precise definition.

ambiguous_language.context: ...There is not enough room along the interior side of the house.
ambiguous_language.reason: Subjective and lacks specific dimensional requirements.
